bibl.title: Judgment Record
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p: Arthur Savoy & Jane his Wife v William Bright Verdict of Judgment for Defendant

Prince Georges County fo William Bright of Prince Georges County Planter was attached to answer unto Arthur Savoy & Jane his wife of a plea wherefore with force and arms at prince Georges County the said William Bright on her the said Jane an assault did make and her the said Jane did beat Wound and Evilly Treat so that of her life it was greatly despaired and other great harmes to her did do to the great damage of her the said Jane and against the Peace of the Right Honourable the Lord Proprietary and so forth And whereupon the same Arthur Savoy &Jane his Wife by Henry Darnall their attorney complains that the afd. William Bright the Sixteenth day of November in the year of our Lord one thousand Seven hundred &fifty five at Prince Georges County afd with force and arms to wit with Firsts, Clubs, Whips, Staves, teeth &nails upon her the said Jane at the County afd an assault did make and her did Beat wound &evilly Treat so that of her life it was greatly despaired and other great harmes to her did against the peace of the Right Honourable the Lord Proprietary that now is &ca and to the damage of the said Arthur Savoy &Jane his wife Thirty pounds Current money of Maryland and therefore they bring suit &ca ... Pledges &ca John Richd and the afd William Bright by Daniel Dulany his attorney Comes &defends the force and Injury when and prays lycence of the Court here to Imparle until the Next County Court to be held at Upper Marlbro Town in said County on the fourth Tuesday in March next and he hath it, and the same day is given to the same Arthur Savoy &Wife here zca. at which day towit the fourt Tuesday in March afd. comes here at the Town before the Justices of the Court here as well the said Arthur &wife as the said William by their attorneys afd the said William by his attorney afd prays further Lycence thereof to Imparle here until the next County Court to be held at Upper Marlbro Town in said County on the fourth Tuesday in June next &he hath it, and the same is given the same Arthur &wife here zca at which day towit the fourth Tuesday in June afd. Comes at the Town afd. before the Justices of the Court here as well the said Arthur &wife as the said William by their attorneys afd. and the said William by his attorney afd prays further Lycence thereof to Imparle here untill the Next County Court to be held at Upper Marlbro Town in said County on the fourth in August next &he hath it and the same day is given the same Arthur Savoy here zca. at which day the fourth Tuesday in August afd. Comes here at the Town afd before the Justices of the Court here as said Arthur & wife as the said William by their Attorneys afd and the said William by his attorney afd
November Court 1756 373
prays further Lycence thereof to Imparle here until the next County Court to be held at Upper Marlbro Town in said County on the fourth Tuesday in November Next and he hath it, and the same day is given the same Arthur and Wife here zca: at which day to wit the fourth Tuesday in November afd. come here at the Town afd before the Justices of the Court here as well the said Arthur &wife as the said William by their attorneys afd and the said Arthur and Wife by their attorneys afd prays that the said William to their Declaration above against him may answer. And the afd. William by Daniel Dulany his attorney comes &defends the forces & Injury when zca. and saith that he is not guilty of the Trespass and assault above said to his Charge, in manner and form as the afd Arthur & James above Complains against him, and of this he puts himself upon the Country &the afd. Arthur & Jane like wises, and the afd William by leave of the Court here & according to the form of the satutes in such cases made & provided, further comes &defends the force & injury when &ca: and as to the Residue of the Trespass and assault, by the said William in the declaration afd above supposed to be done, the said William saith that the afd Arthur & Jane ought not to have their action afd against him, because he saith, that the afd Jane the day and year in the declaration afd above mentioned at the County afd with force and arms upon the said William made an assault, and him the said William then & there would have beaten, wounded and evilly treated, unless the same William then and there had sooner defended himself against the said Jane, and so the said William saith, that if any Damage or Evil then & there accrued to the said Jane, it was of the said Jane's own fault and this the said William is Ready to Verify, wherefore he prays Judgment, if the afd Arthur and Jane ought to have or maintain their action afd against him &ca and the afd Arthur &Jane as to all the Residue of the Trespass and assault by the said William in the declaration afd above supposed to be done, say, that they for anything by the said William above in that behalf by pleading before alledged, ought not to be precluded from having their action afd thereof against him, because they say, that the afd William of his own proper Wrong, and without such causes, as by the said William above in that behalf by pleading alledged, made an assault upon the said Jane, and her did beat, wound and Evilly treat, in manner and form as the afd Arthur &Jane have Complained against the said William and this they pray may be Inquired of the Country, and the afd William likewise. It is therefore Commanded the Sheriff towit Colmore Beanes Gentleman that he cause to come here Immidiately this day to wit the fourth Tuesday in November afd. Twelve &ca by whoom &ca and who neither &ca to Recognize &ca because as well &ca and the same day is further given the Parties afd and now at this day to wit the third Tuesday in November afd comes here again at the Town afd before the Justices of the Court here the Parties afd by their attorneys afd and the Jurors thereon Impannelled being called Namely, Richard Duckett, James Gibbs, William Higgins, Robert Whittaker, Paul Talbutt, James Wood, Thomas Baden, John Berry, James Burgess, James Jones. Daniel Frazer & Benjamin Brooke. Likewise come who to say the truth in the Premises being Elected Tryed and sworn do say upon their oath, that the said William is not Guilty of the Trespass and Assault afd in manner and form as the said Arthur & Jane above in their Declaration against him have Complained, therefore the said William go without day & the said Arthur & Jane in Mercy zca. Whereupon on the prayer of the said William by his attorney afd that Judgment on the Verdict afd for him be Rendered, November 23d 1756. It is considered by the Court here that the said William Recover against the said Arthur & Jane Six Hundred and Fifty Five pounds of Tobacco for his Costs & Charges by him about his defence in this part sustained by the Court hereof the said Lord the Proprietary of the assent of the said William adjudged that thereof he have Execution zca:

Arthur Savoy v William Bright Judgment for Plantif for Costs Prince Georges County fo William Brightt of Prince Georges County Planter was attached to answer unto Arthur Savoy of a plea wherefore with force and arms at Prince Georges County he the said William Brightt on him the said Arthur an assault did make and him the said Arthur did beat wound and evilly Treat so that of his life is was greatly dispaired and other great harms to him did do to the great damage of him the said Arthur and against the Peace of the Right Honourable the Lord Proprietary and soforth. And whereupon the same Arthur Savoy by Henry Darnall his attorney complains that the afd William Brightt the sixteenth day of November in the year of our Lord one Thousand Seven hundred & Fifty five at prince Georges County afd with force & arms to wit Fists, Clubs Whips, Staves Teeth &Nails upon him the said Arthur Savoy at the County afd an assault did make and him did beat wound &evilly Treat so that of his life it was Greatly despaired and other great Enormities to him did against the peace of the Right Honourable the Lord Proprietary thus now is &ca and to the damage of the said Arthur Savoy Thirty Pounds Current Money of Maryland and thereof he brings suit &ca.
